intro: Solidago neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of individual flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its bright yellow inflorescences bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations.
